body.p: To his excellency the Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky your petitioner Daniel G Baker will state at the last term of the Webster Circuit Court he was fined $60 under an indictment for an assault & Battery with Wood Monroe, the facts of the case as proven upon the trial was in substance as followeth- a brother of your petitioner & said Monroe engaged in a fight privately & in the Woods, no person being present except your petitioner & Gwen Tolly - your petitioner urged Tolly to part them. Tolly objected & the brother of your petitioner suceeded in the contest afterwards Tolly your petitioner & his sd brother walked down to the house Monroe followed a short time thereafter. petitioners Brother there proposed peace, which was approbated by your petitioner; Monroe commenced a second dificulty with petitioners brother & Stabed him with a knife and to prevent serious damage & to save his brothers life, he struck Monroe once with a small walking cane for which he was Indicted & fined $60 this was all the testimony in the case wherefore he prays that sd fine be remitted
subscribed & sworn to before me by Daniel G Baker this 14th of april 1864
Wm Herron J P W C
We the undersigned citizens of Webster County do certify that we have read the foregoing petition & we belive the Statements to be true most of us having been present at the trials
